metadata.title: CVE-2020-27171 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.11.8.kernel/bpf/verifier.c has an off-by-one error (with a resultant integerunderflow) affecting out-of-bounds speculation on pointer arithmetic,leading to side-channel attacks that defeat Spectre mitigations and obtainsensitive information from kernel memory, aka CID-10d2bb2e6b1d.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-140-generic - 4.15.0-140.144
linux-image-4.15.0-140-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-140.144
linux-image-4.15.0-140-lowlatency - 4.15.0-140.144
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-140-generic - 4.15.0-140.144
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-140-lowlatency - 4.15.0-140.144
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-72-generic - 5.3.0-72.68

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-140.144').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-72.68').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-70.78~18.04.1').

linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1097.104').
